meanings.definition: Of or relating to a colony that has some degree of independence.
meanings.sent1: The semicolonial town had its own government but still relied on the mother country for support.
meanings.sent2: The island nation was considered semicolonial as it had its own laws but was under the protection of a larger state.
meanings.sent3: The semicolonial village had a unique blend of traditional customs and modern influences.
meanings.sent4: Her style was semicolonial, combining elements of both classic and contemporary fashion.
meanings.sent5: The semicolonial architecture of the building showcased a mix of colonial and local design elements.

meanings.definition: Having characteristics of both a colony and an independent state.
meanings.sent1: The semicolonial region had its own flag and currency, yet still followed some colonial laws.
meanings.sent2: The semicolonial territory enjoyed self-governance while maintaining ties to its former colonial ruler.
meanings.sent3: The semicolonial restaurant served fusion dishes that combined colonial recipes with local ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His personality was semicolonial, displaying traits of both independence and reliance on others.
meanings.sent5: The semicolonial culture of the community celebrated both its colonial past and its present autonomy.
